news.headline: Snap Inc. (NYSE: SNAP) reports Q4 results: 16 cents EPS (beat estimate of 14 cents), $1.55B revenue (beat $1.54B). Snapchat has 453M daily active users, up 9% YoY.
news.summary: After the closing bell on Tuesday, Snap Inc. (NYSE:SNAP) announced its fourth-quarter financial results, surpassing expectations. The company reported earnings of 16 cents per share, surpassing the analyst consensus of 14 cents. Quarterly revenue stood at $1.55 billion, exceeding the anticipated $1.54 billion and showing growth from last year's $1.36 billion. Snapchat saw a 9% increase in daily active users in Q4, reaching 453 million. Snap's progress in community growth and key priorities was evident in the 2024 results. For the full story, visit Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Novo Nordisk reports Q4 earnings: sales of approx. $12.25 billion, with Wegovy sales doubling to 19.87 billion Danish kroner.
news.summary: Novo Nordisk A/S (NYSE:NVO) recently announced fourth-quarter sales of approximately $12.25 billion (85.68 billion Danish kroner), surpassing the expected $11.34 billion (79.73 billion Danish Kroner). This signifies a notable 30% increase in Danish kroner as well as at CER compared to 2023. Specific product sales also experienced growth: GLP-1 diabetes sales rose by 12% at CER to 42.17 billion Danish kroner, while Obesity care sales surged by 91% at CER to 21.41 billion Danish kroner. Ozempic sales saw a 12% increase to 33.85 billion Danish kroner, and Wegovy sales more than doubled to 19.87 billion Danish kroner. Insulin sales climbed by 36% to 15.9 billion Danish kroner, and Rare disease sales grew by 25% at CER to 5.71 billion Danish kroner. For further details, the full story is accessible at Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Google's stock dropped after Alphabet reported Q4 earnings and projected high 2025 capital spending; Meta Platforms remained unaffected.
news.summary: Alphabet, the parent company of Google, saw its stock plummet following the release of its Q4 earnings report. This decline was influenced by the company's announcement of a capital spending projection for 2025 that exceeded expectations. In contrast, Meta Platforms (formerly Facebook) did not experience such repercussions, receiving a more positive reception. This news was covered in an article on Investor's Business Daily.

news.headline: Uber stock falls after Q4 earnings beat views but bookings guidance falls short.
news.summary: Shares of Uber plummeted on Wednesday following the release of its fourth-quarter earnings report. While the company surpassed expectations with Q4 revenue, it fell short of its bookings target, leading to a decline in its stock price. This news was reported by Investor's Business Daily.

news.headline: Disney's earnings surged 44% in Q1 with profitable streaming due to price hikes, sealing sports streaming deal.
news.summary: On Wednesday, Disney announced that its earnings for Q1 exceeded expectations, jumping by 44%. This increase was primarily attributed to the improved profitability of its streaming services following price hikes. The company, a major player in the Dow Jones, also finalized a lucrative sports streaming agreement.

news.headline: Norway sees largest home price increase since 2022 as interest rate cuts on the horizon.
Experts cautiously optimistic as US embraces crypto under 'Crypto Czar.' Bipartisan group aims for stablecoin regulation. Implications for global system. Full story on Benzinga.com.
news.summary: The Trump administration is showing an increased interest in crypto, with David Sacks leading the charge as the designated "Crypto Czar." A bipartisan working group has been formed to harmonize regulatory efforts, focusing on stablecoins and market structure legislation. Todd Ruoff, CEO of Autonomys, emphasized the importance of a measured approach, as stablecoin legislation could impact T-bill prices and interest rates. Stablecoins could potentially strengthen the U.S. dollar by linking their reserve requirements to U.S. Treasuries, creating a new channel for Treasury demand. The community is cautiously optimistic, waiting to see if the proposed changes will truly benefit the crypto ecosystem.

news.headline: Affinia Therapeutics appoints Hideo Makimura, M.D., Ph.D., as CMO, with over 12 IND and Clinical experience in various fields.
news.summary: Experienced physician-scientist and research and development (R&D) executive, possessing ample expertise in early- and late-stage drug advancement across various therapeutic areas such as cardiovascular and neuroscience conditions. With a proven record of accomplishment, has been involved in over 12 Investigational New Drug applications and clinical trials.

news.headline: Top Wall Street analysts raise Arm Holdings price targets ahead of Q3 earnings. Expect 34 cents EPS, $948M revenue, shares rise 4.2% to $162.20. Chinese venture eyes new CEO.
news.summary: Arm Holdings plc, listed on NASDAQ as ARM, is set to announce its Q3 financial results on Wednesday, Feb. 5, 2025, after the markets close. Analysts predict earnings of $0.34 per share, marking an increase from $0.29 per share in the same period last year. The company anticipates quarterly revenue to be $948 million, up from $824 million a year ago. In China, Arm's joint venture is considering Chen Feng, a former Rockchip Electronics Co. executive, as the new CEO, replacing current co-CEOs Liu Renchen and Eric Chen. The stock of Arm Holdings saw a 4.2% increase, closing at $162.20 on Tuesday. For further details, refer to the full article on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Ondo Finance launches platform for onchain trading of stocks and bonds, integrating asset management efficiently.
news.summary: In recent data, the number of coronavirus cases has increased by over 10,000 in the past week, with a total of 50,000 confirmed cases now. Additionally, the death toll has risen to 500, marking a significant increase in the mortality rate. The government has announced new restrictions in response to the surge in cases, including mandatory mask-wearing in public spaces and limits on social gatherings to no more than 10 people. Hospitals are reportedly nearing capacity, with 80% of ICU beds currently occupied. The government is urging the public to adhere to safety measures to prevent further spread of the virus.

news.headline: Sales of Tesla vehicles in Germany and Europe have sharply declined.
Novacium's silicon-anode batteries achieve over 900 cycle efficiency, surpassing top 18650 cells. HPQ Silicon Inc. shares milestone.
news.summary: HPQ Silicon Inc., a technology company focusing on green engineering of silica- and silicon-based materials, has provided an update on the latest impressive battery performance from its partner, NOVACIUM SAS. The news was shared on February 5, 2025. HPQ, listed on the TSX-V as HPQ, on the OTCQB as HPQFF, and on the FRA as O08, shared the positive development with shareholders. The collaboration with Novacium in France has yielded exceptional results, showcasing advancements in battery technology.

news.headline: APi Group to release Q4 2024 earnings on Feb 26, 2025. Conference call scheduled at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.

A webcast/dial-in conference call discussing these results is scheduled for 8:30 a.m. (Eastern Time) on the same day. The call will feature participation from Russell A. Becker.

news.headline: Novo Nordisk files Annual Report 2024 with SEC, available on www.sec.gov and novonordisk.com.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, Novo Nordisk A/S, headquartered in Bagsværd, Denmark, submitted its Annual Report for the fiscal year 2024 via Form 20-F to the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This submission includes selected sections from the Novo Nordisk A/S Annual Report 2024. Interested parties can access these reports on the SEC's website, www.sec.gov, and Novo Nordisk A/S's official site, novonordisk.com.

news.headline: 8x8 beats Q3 earnings estimate with 11 cents per share, misses sales estimate with $178.88 million. Analysts raise forecasts.
news.summary: 8x8, Inc. (NASDAQ:EGHT) released its third-quarter results, revealing earnings of 11 cents per share, surpassing the anticipated 9 cents per share by analysts. The company generated $178.88 million in sales for the quarter, falling slightly short of the expected $179.26 million. This performance demonstrates progress in their transformation journey, marking a 60% increase in new product adoption year-over-year alongside record cash flow from operations. The company's AI-powered customer experience solutions have been driving strong results. For further details, the full story is accessible on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Ice expected to cause slippery commute in New York and Northeast on Thursday.
BizClik Media releases Supply Chain Digital & Procurement Magazine, featuring key industry leaders. 5th Feb 2025, London.
news.summary: The latest issues of Supply Chain Digital & Procurement Magazine for February feature exclusive interviews with top experts and executives from companies such as Coupa, Valpak, BlueYonder, Zycus, and others. Released on February 5, 2025, in LONDON, these editions are from BizClik, the UK's rapidly expanding publishing company. This release showcases insights and perspectives from leaders in the industry, offering valuable information to readers.

news.headline: NXP Semiconductors beats Q4 estimates with earnings of $3.18/share and revenue of $3.11 billion. Forecasts Q1 earnings of $2.39-$2.79/share.
news.summary: NXP Semiconductors NV (NASDAQ:NXPI) announced strong fourth-quarter financial results, surpassing expectations. The company reported earnings of $3.18 per share, exceeding the estimated $3.14 per share. Quarterly revenue stood at $3.11 billion, beating the anticipated $3.104 billion. This figure marks a decrease from the previous year's sales of $3.42 billion during the same period. For the upcoming first quarter, NXP Semiconductors anticipates earnings ranging from $2.39 to $2.79 per share, compared to the estimated $2.68. For more details, refer to the full article on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Post-Election Poll: Elon Musk adored by GOP, loathed by Dems. Tesla faces challenge as potential EV buyers prefer other brands.
news.summary: The reputation of the leader of Tesla poses a significant obstacle for the electric car manufacturer, as a recent survey conducted by the American EV Jobs Alliance revealed that potential electric vehicle (EV) buyers view other brands much more positively. Released on February 5, 2025, in Los Angeles, the poll highlights a challenging situation for Tesla and its leader, as they face less favorable ratings from prospective EV customers compared to their competitors. The survey data shows that Tesla's image may hinder its market position, with key figures indicating a need for the company to address concerns among potential buyers.

news.headline: Calamos launches world's first 90% (CBXJ) and 80% (CBTJ) Downside Protected Bitcoin ETFs with successful launch and attractive cap rates.
news.summary: In Chicago, Illinois on February 5, 2025, John Koudounis, the President and CEO of Calamos, revealed the introduction of two new ETFs. These ETFs present appealing cap rates and aim to provide investors with the possibility of upside growth similar to bitcoin. One ETF offers a 90% protection level (CBXJ), while the other provides an 80% protection level (CBTJ) over the course of one year.

Net income for the quarter was $70.9 million, translating to $1.49 per share, an increase from $42.2 million or $0.82 per share in the same quarter last year. On an adjusted basis, excluding items impacting comparability in both periods, the adjusted net income stood at...

news.headline: HydroGraph earns ISO 9001:2015 certification, emphasizing commitment to quality with consistent graphene production.
news.summary: HydroGraph's commitment to delivering top-notch graphene is underscored by the ISO 9001 certification, emphasizing their focus on maintaining superior quality and consistent performance across batches.

news.headline: American Tungsten Corp. analyzes historical drilling data from IMA Mine Project in Idaho, USA. 13 holes drilled in 2007-2008 totaling 22,088 feet by Gentor Resources, Inc.
news.summary: American Tungsten Corp. has finished reviewing Gentor Resources, Inc.'s historical drillhole data at the IMA Mine property, where Gentor drilled a total of 13 holes between 2007 and 2008, covering 22,088 feet. The information from this drilling program is well-documented with both digital and printed records along with existing drill core. American Tungsten Corp. operates under the tickers CSE:TUNG, OTCQB:DEMRF, and FSE:RK9.

news.headline: Stallion Uranium starts electromagnetic survey on drill targets in Athabasca Basin JV Uranium; located in Saskatchewan, Canada.
news.summary: VANCOUVER, BC - On February 5, 2025, Stallion Uranium Corp. (TSX-V: STUD; OTCQB: STLNF; FSE: FE0) revealed the initiation of a detailed ground-based Time Domain Electromagnetic Survey on its Western Athabasca Basin JV Uranium project in Athabasca Basin, SK, Canada.

news.headline: Hydreight Technologies adds NAD+ therapy to VSDHOne platform for personalized wellness, including patch, injection, and nasal spray options.
news.summary: Introducing the latest in personalized wellness and longevity solutions - the new NAD+ patch, injection, and nasal spray are now accessible to the public. These innovative products aim to enhance overall health and promote longevity. The NAD+ patch, injection, and nasal spray offer convenient methods of providing essential nutrients to the body. Individuals looking to improve their well-being can now benefit from these options. This development marks a significant advancement in personal wellness, with the new products offering promising results.

news.headline: Stock Yards Bancorp (NASDAQ: SYBT) to attend KBW Winter Financial Services Conference with top executives.

Clay Stinnett, EVP and CFO, will be attending the Keefe, Bruyette & Woods’ Winter Financial Services Conference from February 12th to 14th. The parent company of Stock Yards Bank & Trust Company, operating in Louisville and other parts of Kentucky, as well as the Indianapolis and Cincinnati metropolitan areas, will engage in various one-on-one meetings with institutional investors during the event.

news.headline: FirstService releases financial results for Q4 and full year.
news.summary: A recent report reveals that the unemployment rate in the United States has risen to 6.1% in the month of March, with a total of 9.8 million people currently out of work. This increase is partly due to the ongoing impact of the pandemic on the economy. The job market saw a decrease of 35,000 jobs in March, mainly in sectors like retail and construction. Despite this setback, there is optimism for the future as vaccination efforts continue and more states begin to ease restrictions, potentially leading to an improvement in the employment situation in the coming months.

news.headline: Brink’s (NYSE: BCO) sets Q4 & full year 2024 earnings release for Feb 26, 2025, with conference call at 9:00 am ET.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, a company based in Richmond, Virginia, The Brink’s Company (NYSE:BCO), known for its services in cash and valuables management, digital retail solutions, and ATM managed services, announced they will be hosting a conference call on February 26 at 9:00 a.m. (ET). The purpose of the call is to discuss the financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2024. These results are scheduled to be published on the same day prior to the conference call.

news.headline: Torchy’s Tacos teams up with PAR Technology for new loyalty program called Torchy’s Tacos Rewards to enhance customer experience.
news.summary: In a recent announcement, Torchy’s Tacos, known for its renowned “Damn Good Tacos,” has partnered with PAR Punchh, a prominent loyalty and engagement platform under PAR Technology Corporation (NYSE: PAR). The objective behind this collaboration is to enhance customer experience and forge stronger bonds with their loyal customer base. The joint effort has resulted in the unveiling of Torchy’s Tacos Rewards, an innovative loyalty initiative that incorporates tailored rewards, unexpected perks, and smooth operational features to revolutionize customer engagement. This strategic move reflects Torchy’s Tacos dedication to enhancing the way customers connect with the brand.

news.headline: Gibraltar Industries to announce Q4 2024 financial results on Feb 19 at 7:30 am ET. Conference call at 9:00 am ET.
news.summary: Gibraltar Industries, Inc., a prominent manufacturer in various markets including residential, renewable energy, agtech, and infrastructure, disclosed plans to unveil its fourth quarter financial outcomes for 2024 around 7:30 a.m. ET on Wednesday, February 19, 2025. The company trades on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol ROCK.

news.headline: Edmonton brokerage YEGPro Realty joins Real, adding 57 agents to Real's Alberta community, totaling over 1,000 agents.
news.summary: In a recent announcement, Real Estate Brokerage Real welcomed YEGPro Realty to its team, incorporating 57 agents from Alberta. With this addition, the total number of agents in Real's Alberta community has now surpassed 1,000 agents, indicating significant growth in their network.

news.headline: Realbotix Corp reports potential US-Canada tariffs pose insignificant risk, operations unaffected by 25% tariffs effective February 4, 2025.
news.summary: In Las Vegas, Realbotix Corp. (XBOT on TSX-V, 76M0.F on Frankfurt Stock Exchange, XBOTF on OTC) shared that potential tariffs between the US and Canada would minimally impact its operations. The announcement on February 2, 2025, revealed a 25% tariff set to go into effect on February 4, 2025, for goods moving between the two countries. Realbotix remains unaffected by the tariffs.

news.headline: Global primary hepatocytes market to grow with increasing demand, reaching US$ 486 million by 2034. North America leads, with US worth US$ 88 million by 2024. China contributes nearly 48% of the East Asia market.
news.summary: The global primary hepatocytes market was valued at US$189.5 million in 2019 and is projected to reach US$255.6 million in 2024, with an expected annual growth rate of 6.6% until 2034. By 2034, the industry is forecasted to be worth US$486 million. Increased focus on liver cell toxicity studies and drug metabolism investigation are driving sales in the healthcare biotechnology and pharmaceutical sectors. North America's market is estimated to be US$88 million in 2024, with the United States accounting for 80% and expected to grow at a 5.1% CAGR. Canada and Mexico are projected to have CAGRs of 6.2% and 8.6%, respectively. In East Asia, total sales are anticipated to reach US$47 million in 2024, with China constituting 47.9% and expected to grow at a 6.5% CAGR. Japan and South Korea are expected to see CAGRs of 7.8% and 8.5%, respectively.

news.headline: Global micropump market expected to reach USD 12.4 Bn by 2034, growing at CAGR of 18.7% driven by healthcare, chemical, and industrial sectors, enabled by advanced technologies and IoT integration.
news.summary: The global micropump market was valued at US$1.9 billion in 2023 and is projected to reach US$12.4 billion by the end of 2034 with a CAGR of 18.7%. The market growth is driven by the aging population and increased adoption of advanced hearing solutions. Micropumps are essential in various sectors like healthcare, chemical, and industry, known for their precision in managing micro-scale fluid volumes. Key players in the market include LEE Ventus Limited, Sensile Medical AG, and Cole-Parmer India. Manufacturers are focusing on developing cost-effective, energy-efficient, and compact micropumps for portable and wearable devices. The market is witnessing growth due to increasing investments in healthcare infrastructure and rising adoption of microfluidics in drug development. Micropumps are also integrated into industrial processes for precise fluid handling.

news.headline: Anavex Life Sciences announcing fiscal 2025 Q1 results on Feb 12, 2025, with webcast and conference call at 8:30 am ET.
news.summary: A live webcast and conference call are scheduled to take place on Wednesday, February 12, 2025, starting at 8:30 am Eastern Time. This event will provide important information and updates to attendees. Make sure to mark your calendars for this significant presentation.

news.headline: Grand opening of Natural Grocers® in Waco, Texas on Feb 19, 2025. Celebrate with giveaways, savings, sweepstakes, and free samples.
news.summary: Celebrate with exciting perks including giveaways, special discounts, a sweepstakes, complimentary samples, and more at the latest store opening in Lakewood, Colorado on February 5, 2025. Natural Grocers®, a top organic and natural grocery retailer run by a family, is officially launching this store. Engage in the festivities and enjoy great offers at the leading U.S. store of its kind.

Global self-drive car rental market valued at US$25.5 Billion in 2024, projected to reach US$76.5 Billion by 2030, with 50+ players in the industry.
news.summary: Dublin - A new report titled "Self-Drive Car Rental - Global Strategic Business Report" is now available on ResearchAndMarkets.com. The global market for self-drive car rental reached a value of US$25.5 billion in 2024, with projections indicating it will reach US$76.5 billion by 2030. This represents a CAGR of 20.1% from 2024 to 2030. The report offers a detailed analysis of market trends, drivers, and forecasts to assist businesses in making informed decisions. Self-drive car rental services continue to grow in popularity and are expected to see significant expansion in the coming years.

news.headline: Scatec ASA raises funds with successful senior unsecured green bonds issuance, amount undisclosed.
Harley-Davidson's stock falls post Q4 loss due to challenges in discretionary market; facing 'cyclical headwinds'.
Merger talks between Honda and Nissan, Japan's top automakers, at risk. Aim to create largest car group globally.
news.summary: Two major Japanese car manufacturers are currently discussing a merger to create one of the largest automotive groups globally.

news.headline: CasinoRIX examines online casino players' key concerns and pain points based on last quarter's data.
news.summary: In Toronto on February 5, 2025, a comprehensive gambling solution called CasinoRIX was introduced. This innovative platform aims to streamline the decision-making process for players by offering professional advice and instant assistance. Recently, CasinoRIX published a detailed analysis addressing the key challenges faced by online casino enthusiasts. The report focuses on the main 'pain points' experienced by players in the industry. In the previous quarter, CasinoRIX witnessed significant growth in its user base, with a notable increase in customer engagement and satisfaction. This analytical article sheds light on the common issues encountered by online gamblers, offering valuable insights for both new and experienced players.

news.headline: Bargain Hunt starts Going-Out-of-Business sale at 92 locations in 10 states after bankruptcy filing, unprecedented discounts offered.

news.headline: Vishay Intertechnology reports fiscal Q4 and full year 2024 results. Dec 31 revenue: $X. (NYSE: VSH)
news.summary: Vishay Intertechnology, Inc., a leading manufacturer of discrete semiconductors and passive electronic components, revealed its financial performance for the fiscal fourth quarter and full year ending on December 31, 2024.
